translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Ekavihāri
“Having seen the Buddha in the wilderness,
the Self-Made One, the Unconquered One,
and offered it to the Self-Made One.
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of offering the fruit.
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ambāṭakadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmai ambāṭakadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Ambāṭakadāyaka recited these verses.
The Elder Ambāṭakadāyaka’s Birth Story is the seventh.
